questions.question: In a Physics experiment, a student filled a burette with water up to a level of 15 ml. The student ran out 3 drops of water each of volume 2 cm from the burette into a beaker. Determine the final reading of the burette.
State two factors that affect the angular velocity of a body moving in a circular path

options.a: Mass and radius of the body
options.b: Mass and speed of the body
options.c: Radius and speed of the body
options.d: Mass and time of the body

questions.answer: Radius and speed of the body

questions.question: In an experiment, a drop of black ink is introduced at the bottom of a container filled with water. It is observed that the water gradually turns black. State the effect on the observation when the experiment is carried out using water at a lower temperature.

options.a: The water will turn black faster
options.b: The water will turn black slower
options.c: The water will not turn black
options.d: The water will turn black at the same rate

questions.answer: The water will turn black slower

questions.question: Define the term 'specific latent heat of fusion' of a substance

options.a: The amount of heat required to change a unit mass of a substance from solid to liquid state without a change in temperature
options.b: The amount of heat required to change a unit mass of a substance from liquid to solid state without a change in temperature
options.c: The amount of heat required to change a unit mass of a substance from solid to liquid state with a change in temperature
options.d: The amount of heat required to change a unit mass of a substance from liquid to solid state with a change in temperature

questions.answer: The amount of heat required to change a unit mass of a substance from solid to liquid state without a change in temperature

questions.question: A student carries out an experiment to determine the focal length of a concave mirror. The student places the object pin between the principal focus and the pole of the mirror. State the position of the image formed.

options.a: Between the principal focus and the pole of the mirror
options.b: At the principal focus of the mirror
options.c: At the pole of the mirror
options.d: Beyond the principal focus of the mirror

questions.answer: Beyond the principal focus of the mirror

questions.question: State the effect on the period of a simple pendulum when the length of the pendulum is increased

Ice of mass 5g at a temperature of -10°C is immersed into 10.5g of hot water at 100°C in a container of negligible heat capacity. All the ice melts and the final temperature of the mixture is 40°C. Assuming there are no heat losses to the surrounding and taking the specific latent heat of fusion for ice as L (Cwar = 4200 Jkg-K and C = 2100 Jkg 'K). Determine the: i. heat lost by the hot water. ii. heat gained by ice from -10°C to 0°C. iii. heat required to melt the ice in terms of Lf iv. heat gained by the melted ice. v. specific latent heat of fusion of ice.
